ai.summary: Maywick Deepdale coastal route is a short, easy 2.4 km coastal walk in the UK, offering sea views, rocky shoreline, and a gentle, well-defined path that suits beginners and casual hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows a coastal track that is mostly flat to gently undulating with compact gravel and packed soil. Expect exposed sections with sea spray and occasional rocky patches near the shore; surfaces can be slippery when wet, and wind exposure is common along the coast.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before walking any coastal section and avoid exposed areas at high tide. Stay on the marked path, keep a safe distance from cliff edges, and be prepared for sudden weather changes; wear sturdy, grippy footwear and bring a windproof/waterproof layer, a map or GPS, and a small first aid kit. Carry a charged phone, know local emergency numbers, and tell someone your planned return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes with good grip
Map or GPS device (or offline map on smartphone)
Charged phone and portable power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for this coastal route; summer provides light winds and sea views, while autumn and winter can bring stronger winds and wetter conditions—check the forecast and tide times before you go.

seo.title: Maywick Deepdale coastal route – Easy 2.4 km coastal hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Maywick Deepdale coastal route, a short and easy 2.4 km hike along the UK coast with sea views, rocky shores, and a gentle terrain suitable for beginners.
